metadata.Title: CVE-2019-19449 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - low
metadata.Description:
In the Linux kernel 5.0.21, mounting a crafted f2fs filesystem image canlead to slab-out-of-bounds read access in f2fs_build_segment_manager infs/f2fs/segment.c, related to init_min_max_mtime in fs/f2fs/segment.c(because the second argument to get_seg_entry is not validated).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-19449` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.2.0-20-generic - 5.15.0-25.25
linux-image-6.2.0-20-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-25.25
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-20-generic - 5.15.0-25.25
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-20-generic-64k - 5.15.0-25.25
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-aws - 5.15.0-1004.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-azure - 5.15.0-1003.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1005-gcp - 5.15.0-1003.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-oracle - 5.15.0-1002.4
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-1004-raspi - 5.15.0-1005.5
linux-image-6.2.0-1004-raspi-nolpae - 5.15.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1001-ibm - 5.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-lowlatency - 5.15.0-24.24
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-lowlatency-64k - 5.15.0-24.24
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-25.25').
linux-aws package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1004.6').
